docs.text: Buttons All buttons have been based upon the Bootstrap buttons. Types of Buttons There are three buttons that you can use: btn-primary - Main button btn-outline-primary - Ghost button btn-outline-light - Ghost button with white text color You can add the buttons as follow: Add icons It's also possible to add an icon inside the button. Just find the icon you want to use and add the HTML code inside of it: Extra classes You can also give a flat shadow to the button and/or make the button wider with btn--shadow btn--wider: Scroll to a div in page function When a user clicks on a button you can make the user scroll to a div ID inside the page by adding the id as an href with an hash before it. Don't forget to add the smoothscroll class, otherwise the button won't scroll the page to the div.

docs.text: When a user clicks on a button you can make the user scroll to a div ID inside the page by adding the id as an href with an hash before it. Don't forget to add the smoothscroll class, otherwise the button won't scroll the page to the div. <!-- Button with contact as an id, don't forget the hash --> <button type="button" href="#contact" class="btn btn-primary smoothscroll">Hire Me</button> <!-- Somewhere on the page the id is contact --> <section class="contact" id="contact">

docs.text:
Navigation The navigation has mainly been created for an onepage interaction. It does work as well for multipage interactions. The navigation has been built upon the Bootstrap navbar. This is the main structure:
  • Home
  • About
  • Portfolio
  • Pricing
  • Testimonials
  • Blog
  • Contact
Logo You can replace the logo in the navbar-brand div. It's possible to use one logo as well. Just remove one of the two logo and the extra class like: navbar-logo--inverted, or navbar-logo--default. Please check out the index-dark.html as an example for one logo only. This is an example for the logo swap version: Navigation Items You can easily link the navigation items to a div on the page. Just make sure that the div on the page has got the same id as the href. Example: About
You can also link to other pages. Just remove the hash in the href and the JS script won't be looking for a div ID in the page any longer.

docs.text:
Portfolio The portfolio has been built with Isotope . It has a filter and the portfolio items. Connecting the filters to the items The main thing you probably want to know is how to connect the filter with the items. It's simple: Create a filter and add a data-filter for your category, don't forget to add the . before it, example:
All Branding Digital Graphic Design Photography
Next add the item in the portfolio container. Add the categories as classes to the item to connect it to the filter, example:
Branding
Timeless Campaign
Changing settings You can find the Isotope settings in /assets/js/custom.js. Please edit the settings according to the documentation of Isotope .

docs.text: Basic Structure HTML framework This template has been built with Bootstrap. Bootstrap is the most popular HTML framework in the world. Bootstrap is very well documented and is easy to master. If you're new to Bootstrap please go to getbootstrap.com before you start to edit the HTML of this template. SCSS (advanced) All SCSS files are included into this project and can be compiled with the compiler to your liking. You'll need to compile main.scss in order to create a complete CSS. All default styling variables can be found in: abstract/scss/variables.scss. You can generate color-dark.scss and rtl.scss seperatly if you need them. The rest of the structure the SCSS files is straightforward. CSS (beginner) There are also CSS files available for those that don't want to work with SCSS: main.css - the main CSS file with everything in it color-custom.css - easily change the colors of the template color-dark.css - the dark styled rtl.css - right-to-left stylesheet Please make sure that the CSS files are included in the HEAD if you want to use them. jQuery This template has been built with jQuery. jQuery is a very popular JavaScript library. js/custom.js is the jQuery file for this template. You can change settings and code in this file if needed. Please go to: https://www.w3schools.com/jquery/ if you want to learn jQuery. Images All images can be found in the images folder. Just open one of the images in your photo editing application and replace the content. This way you'll always use the correct resolution for the images. Good image compression is key for your page speed. Go to https://squoosh.app if you need good compression for your images. Fonts This template makes use of the Google Font Poppins . You can use any font you want. Just replace the font in the head of all the HTML files and make sure it's set in SCSS and/or CSS. Icons LineIcons are used inside this template. You can find all of the icons at: https://lineicons.com . Animations You can simply add or edit appear-animations within the template. Just add data-aos="fade" to your div and add the aos-init class. The animation will play when the div comes in your screen. You can find all possibilities at https://michalsnik.github.io/aos/ . Minified versions There are also concatenated minified versions of both of the JS and the CSS files. These will give you the best pagespeed results if needed, but it's nearly impossible to edit these files. You can however minify edited files yourself, but please note that minifying your files is not supported by the theme author. To use the existing minified files you have to edit the header and footer of your HTML files. Remove the CSS files and replace them with: <link rel="stylesheet" href="assets/css/vendors.min.css"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="assets/css/main.min.css"> You can still add the RTL or color stylesheets at the bottom of these stylesheets. For the JS files do as follow: Remove the JS files and replace it with: <script src="assets/js/main.min.js"></script>
docs.title: Basic Structure
